basics.name: Elliot Alderson
basics.label: Cybersecurity Engineer
basics.summary: Highly talented and accomplished IT professional with 10+ years industry experience specializing in cybersecurity. Proven ability to deploy, administrate, maintain and secure IT infrastructures. Also, I'm an imaginary software engineer from the american drama–thriller television series Mr. Robot, created by Sam Esmail.

employment.summary: 10+ years industry experience specializing in cybersecurity

history.summary: At my job with Allsafe Cybersecurity I'm responsible with maintaining and securing client IT infrastructures.
highlights: Developed and implemented online security procedures
Worked with management to set security standards and manuals

history.summary: My responsibility at BigCorp Inc. was to find holes in their system, until it was 'hacker-proof'.
highlights: Developed complicated network infrastructure from scratch
Secured running applications and full network infrastructure

education.summary: I received a Bachelor's degree in Computer Sience from Columbia University, New York City. I then specialized with a Master's degree in Computer Security also at CU NY.

highlights: Intrusion and Anomaly Detection Systems
Computer Communication Networks
Advanced Database Systems
Advanced Machine Learning

projects.summary: In my spare time I like to play around with new technologies. I'm always trying to improve my skills as a security expert, and personal projects are a great way to do that.

history.title: OpenDoor
history.description: A tool to check a system for open ports and other known security holes
highlights: #1 top rated app in iTunes category 'Security Application'
Over 1.3 million downloads

openSource.summary: I'm also involved in several open-source projects related to online security, privacy and user freedom.

history.title: Tor
history.description: Tor is free software and an open network that helps you defend against traffic analysis, a form of network surveillance that threatens personal freedom and privacy, confidential business activities and relationships, and state security.
highlights: Over 50 of my patches were accepted and merged into the core code base

history.title: F-coin
history.description: F-coin is a peer-to-peer cryptocurrency and open source software project released under the MIT/X11 license
highlights: Voted #1 most promising bitcoin alternative by Mashable
Market cap of $2.4 B

skills.summary: I have been programming for over 20 years, 10 of those professionaly as an employed software engineer. In the last 5 years of my career I have specialized in cyber security.

sets.name: Computer Security
sets.description: Although to completely secure a system you have to know every layer of the stack, there are some common tools that I use on a regular basis.

sets.name: Programming
sets.description: I use the tool which is right for the job, and I am certain I can pick up any programming language that is necessary to get the task done.

qualifications.summary: Additionally to my bachelor and master degree I try to keep up with current technology, by taking part in online courses and getting certified by third party vendors.

history.title: Cybersecurity Specialization
history.summary: The Cybersecurity Specialization covers the fundamental concepts underlying the construction of secure systems, from the hardware to the software to the human-computer interface, with the use of cryptography to secure interactions.
highlights: Learned foundations of modern cryptography, with an eye toward practical applications.
Applied security and trust from the hardware perspective
Understand the vulnerabilities in current digital system design flow and the physical attacks to these systems

history.title: ITIL® Master Qualification (ITILMA)
history.summary: The ITIL Master Qualification Certificate validates the capability of the candidate to apply the principles, methods and techniques from ITIL in the workplace.
highlights: The ITIL Master Qualification is the highest level in the Official ITIL Qualification Scheme
The ITIL Master builds upon the knowledge gained through the core qualification scheme and validates practical application of the ITIL framework in the work place.

history.title: Google Summer of Code
history.summary: Google Summer of Code is a global program that offers post-secondary student developers stipends to write code for various open source software projects.
highlights: Paired with a mentor from participating projects, exposing them to real-world software development
Great opportunity to work on a large, and extremely popular open source project

writing.summary: After extensive studying and exploring current technologies in the cryptography field, I summarized my findings in my first book 'Applied Cryptography'

history.title: Applied Cryptography
history.summary: Cryptography or cryptology is the practice and study of techniques for secure communication in the presence of third parties called adversaries. More generally, cryptography is about constructing and analyzing protocols that prevent third parties or the public from reading private messages;
highlights: Over 100 000 copies sold
University of Chicago Award for Publishing in Computer Science

reading.summary: I like to stay on top of current technologies by reading a lot of books. The most impressive and transformative book that I read this year was Post-Quantum Cryptography, by Daniel J. Bernstein and Johannes Buchmann.

history.title: Post-Quantum Cryptography
history.author: Daniel J. Bernstein and Johannes Buchmann
history.summary: This book is an essential resource for students and researchers who want to contribute to the field of post-quantum cryptography.
highlights: Next generation of cryptographic algorithms,
The state of the art in quantum computing, hash-based cryptography, code-based cryptography, lattice-based cryptography, and multivariate cryptography

speaking.summary: This year I gave my first talk at a big conference. I want to do more of them, and I've already been asked and agreed to speak at multiple conferences the following year.

history.title: Viability and the future of cryptocurrencies
history.location: Columbia University in New York City
history.summary: In this talk I gave a brief overview of the cryptocurrency landscape, arguments for and against its viability, and my opinion about the future.
highlights: Keynote speaker at biggest cryptography conference in the world

patents.summary: Through my work on F-coin (see projects section), I gained deep insight in cryptocurrency and was able to patent some of my break-throughs.

history.title: Anonymous peer-to-peer verification through cryptographic key-address mapping
history.description: Disclosed is a method for peer-to-peer verification through cryptography key-address mapping, which allows users of a cryptocurrency to verify the authenticity of a transaction without the need to disclose privat information of involved parties.
highlights: Key patent for an anonymous cryptocurrency
